However, the bear was not deterred and continued to steal honey. One day, the bees decided to take action. They built a large trap for the bear and lured him into it.
Inside the trap, the bear found himself surrounded by a sea of honey. He was unable to move and was trapped in his own voracious appetite.
As the honey began to fill his belly, the bear felt a sense of satisfaction. He had finally gotten the honey he had been craving.
But as the honey continued to fill his body, the bear began to feel unwell. He was choking on the honey and could breathe only with great difficulty.
The bees, having already seen the bear's greed, were relieved to see him pay for it. They fed him honey until he was finally able to choke on it and die.
